text: The Diocese of Temotu is one of the nine current dioceses of the Anglican Church of Melanesia, founded in 1981. Three of the diocese's six bishops have gone on to become three of the Church's six archbishops. ==List of bishops== {| class="wikitable" style="width: 95%;" |- ! colspan="4" style="background- color: #7F1734; color: white;" | Bishops of Temotu |- ! style="background- color: #D4B1BB; width: 8%;" | From ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; width: 8%;" | Until ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; width: 33%;" | Incumbent ! style="background-color: #D4B1BB; width: 46%;" | Notes |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1981 | style="text-align: center;" | 1987 | Amos Waiaru | First bishop; became Archbishop of Melanesia in 1988. |- valign="top" style="background-color: #F7F0F2;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1987 | style="text-align: center;" | ? | Lazarus Munamua | Second bishop; consecrated and installed on 20 September 1987.List of small publications in the Archives of the Anglican Church of Melanesia (in the National Archives of Solomon Islands) pp. 14–15. (Accessed 25 August 2016) |- valign="top" style="background-color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 1999 | style="text-align: center;" | 2009 | David Vunagi | Third bishop; became Archbishop of Melanesia in 2009. |- valign="top" style="background-color: #F7F0F2;" | style="text-align: center;" | ? | style="text-align: center;" | 2016 | George Takeli | Fourth bishop; became Archbishop of Melanesia in 2016. |- valign="top" style="background- color: white;" | style="text-align: center;" | 2016 | style="text-align: center;" | 2019 | Leonard Dawea | Fifth bishop; became Archbishop |} ==References== Temotu, Diocese of Category:Melanesia Category:Christian organizations established in 1981 Category:1981 establishments in Oceania Category:Bishops of Temotu
title: Diocese of Temotu
